page.title: 03BELLEEK BARRACKS
page.content: BELLEEK IS ON THE BORDER IN NORTHERN IRELAND AND HAS A JOINT POLICE AND ARMY BARRACKS.OFTEN ARMY PATROLS WALK THROUGH THE SCHOOL GROUNDS AND HELICOPTERS LAND IN THE FIELD BESIDE THE SCHOOL.THE BARRACK HAS BEEN ATTACKED MANY TIMES.THE LAST ATTACK WAS WITH A CAR BOMB.A RESERVE POLICEMAN WAS KILLED WHEN A ROCKET CAME THROUGH A WINDOW AS HE WALKED DOWNSTAIRS IN THE BARRACK . THE LOCAL CUSTOMS POST HAS BEEN BURNED OR BLOWN UP OVER 30 TIMES AND THE LOCAL HOTEL TWICE.A LOT OF THE TOWN WAS DAMAGED WHEN THE HOTEL WAS BOMBED.POLICE CARS PATROL THE ROADS AND THE ARMY CHECKS THE ROAD CULVERTS FOR LAND MINES AND SOMETIMES USE SNIFFER DOGS FOR THIS. THE ARMY USED TO USE ARMOURED CARS BUT IT IS NOW MOSTLY FOOT PATROLS.THE HELICOPTER SOMETIMES COMES AT NIGHT WITH A BRIGHT SEARCHLIGHT.
